meanings.definition: In the direction of the ocean.
meanings.sent1: The ship sailed oceanward, guided by the stars above.
meanings.sent2: She looked oceanward, hoping to catch a glimpse of a dolphin.
meanings.sent3: The seagull flew oceanward, mistaking a shiny object for a fish.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts drifted oceanward, lost in the vastness of the sea.
meanings.sent5: The waves crashed oceanward, echoing the heartbeat of the ocean.

meanings.sent1: The children ran oceanward, eager to feel the sand between their toes.
meanings.sent2: The path led oceanward, promising a breathtaking view of the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was set up oceanward, risking a sudden tide washing it away.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed oceanward, merging with the salty waters of the sea.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse stood tall, guiding ships safely oceanward through the night.
